title: Refactor project creation: DPP and machines as economic resources
description:
Change how projects are saved: 1) DPP should be stored as a separate economic resource (not in metadata) and cited via economic event. 2) Machines should be stored as separate economic resources and cited. 3) Update CreateProjectForm UI to match Figma design (node-id=348-17380) with machines selection.

NOTE (2025-12): /products filtering is currently blocked by backend filter limitations. To unblock in GUI, we will ALSO persist derived tags on save:
- machine-<slug> for each selected/cited machine
- material-<slug> for each selected consumed material (consume event)
This enables filtering via existing classifiedAs/tag filter (see epic interfacer-gui-kjq and epic interfacer-gui-f61.13).

This epic remains focused on the ValueFlows economic resource model; the tag-based workaround is additive (not a replacement).

title: Workaround: Persist machine/material tags on product save
description:
Goal: unblock /products filtering without waiting for backend metadata filters by persisting machine/material info as standard tags.

Approach (GUI-side):
- When saving a Project Product that cites one or more machines, also add tags for each machine using a stable prefix format: machine-<slug> (e.g., machine-laser-cutter).
- Do the same for materials: user selects materials consumed; create consume economic events (1 per material) and also add tags material-<slug>.
- Remove manual/free-form tag insertion from the creation form (tags become derived/controlled; category/tag selection for browsing remains on /products).

Acceptance:
- Newly created/edited products persist machine-* and material-* tags consistently.
- Tag format is deterministic (slugify rules documented) so filter UI can generate exact tag strings.
- No backend changes required except pre-creating material economic resources conforming to a Material ResourceSpecification (tracked separately).
